content: “Removing existing educational materials about Islam would also deprive students of the opportunity to learn about the fastest growing religion in the world, at a time when violent Islamophobia — largely predicated on misunderstanding — is on the rise.” Actually, it’s largely predicated on the violent acts done under the banner of Islam. “They describe the pillars of Islam, Muslim American life, women in Islam, and sacred texts — altogether providing a comprehensive guide to the religion.” Follow the link and read through the lesson plans, but as you do, substitute the word “Christians” for “Muslims”, substitute “Holy Bible” for “Qur’an”, and substitute “Resurrection Sunday” for “Ramadan”. Then ask yourself if you would have any issues with such a comprehensive guide used to enhance the understanding of Christianity.
